info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 07 at 2:31AM PDT until May 07 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 5000 feet expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. West winds gusting 25 to 35 mph could cause blowing and drifting snow at times, along with reduced visibility. * WHERE...South Central Oregon and Southern Oregon Cascades, including the Crater Lake National Park and Diamond Lake areas, as well as the Cascade passes along highways 138, 230, 58, and 62. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions should be expected in this area during the time of this advisory. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Roads are likely to be slick and snow covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates around one inch per hour with visibility less than one half of a mile are likely during periods of heavier snowfall. Road conditions could change quickly going from wet to snow covered in less than a half hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
